Fields.DialogueText: How goes the playing?
What do you think? If you had ears, you'd know it was fine.
What song is that?
"Honky Tonk Train Blues" is the tune, Captain.
A little boogie-woogie is good for the soul.
How do you mean?
There's something energetic about it.
It sure woke me up the first time I heard it. I'm surprised you know boogie-woogie, Captain.
I have a radio.
Not everybody with a radio is a fan of this kind of music. Are you a closet musician?

Fields.MenuText: There's music everywhere. You just have to know how to hear it.
I sing in the shower. Does that count?
I enjoy noodling. Morganas are my instrument and battles my song.

Fields.DialogueText: You've got a good ear, Captain. First step to good taste.
It's a start.
I've heard that tune once or twice.
Hold that note...
My favorite ditty: the Ballad of the Interrupting Morganas.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
They've got bad rhythm and worse technique, and I'm back and forth on which hurts more.
You look bored, Captain. I know what will perk you up. Care for a nip?
That depends. Is the coast clear, so to speak?
Is it ever clear? You have to grab each moment.
Carpe diem... Is that your motto?
Carpe who? I want to drink deeply of life.
I'm jealous of your zest.
Life's too short to second-guess. What do you really want to do?
I want to win this war.
After that. Imagine we win the war. We will win the war. And then what?

Fields.MenuText: I am thinking more day to day at this point.
Maybe I set up shop here, with you on this boat.
I have no idea.

Fields.DialogueText: That'll have to do for now. Usually works for me.
That sounds terrible. For you, I mean.
At least you've got imagination.
Thanks for the vote of confidence. Maybe I will have some of that moonshine.
Too late for that! Morganas are approaching.
Just my luck.
Last line of defense, Cap. I've got the first few locked down and most of those explode.
@BATTLE
Nashville, can I ask you something? Why is everyone in Nashville a musician?
It seems that way, doesn't it? Even if it's just playing a washboard.
I've noticed that myself. Incredible amount of talent there.
Well, thank you very much! I suspect it has something to do with the ability of music to raise people's spirits when they've been in the valley.
In the valley?
The Great Depression was mighty hard on us.
I'm glad to see you two getting along. Have you been properly introduced?
He's from the Navy Department and seems to know his way around a ship. That counts for a lot.
Well, the same man who brought us the New Deal said "War is a condition." What's the connection there?
Clatch, if you want to quote history, try to get it right. He said, "War is a contagion."
It's infested us all, it seems.
Oof... Those damn Morganas!
Now, Nashville...
They are enraging.
They are gonna get their asses served to them is what they are.
That's the spirit. Yeehaw!
One day I'm gonna drink on their graves.

Fields.MenuText: Yeehaw?
What happened to decorum?
I'll toast to that!

Fields.DialogueText: Yes. It's Tennessean for Yessir-and-Goddamn!
It went the way of the dodo.
With some good old-fashioned Tennessee moonshine!
Our toast will have to wait. Morganas approach.
Ready to rumble?
I always am.
We'll jaw some more later. Stay alive, Clatch.
@BATTLE
Name's Clatch, Miss. Just here for a ride-along, taking a few notes on the enemy. It helps that the man in the White House spent some time in my line of work.
Nice to have someone up top who knows what to do with us.
Are those new boots?
These babies? Naw. I just gussied them up with some polish and spit. First time I've polished 'em.
Why does that not surprise me?
I don't know, Captain. Maybe because you polish your boots every day.
I've got a lot of bad habits, it seems.
No. It's weird, but I like to see your shiny boots.

Fields.MenuText: What's the saying? "Cleanliness is next to godliness?"
I didn't think you'd noticed.
Maybe it's rubbing off on you.

Fields.DialogueText: One out of two ain't bad.
I notice everything, Captain, whether I want to or not.
I wouldn't get your hopes up.
What's the occasion?
Occasion?
For polishing your boots?
Does it need an occasion? Don't worry, when it's my birthday or something, I will tell you. Achoo!
Bless you! Here you go...
Thanks, but I got my own.
Aren't you prepared?
When you have allergies like mine, you gotta be.
Nothing, I suppose. I hope you're prepared for the approaching Morganas!
It's them that need to be prepared for me!
@BATTLE
What of it?
Allergies.
Nashville, remember our conversation with Clatch?
Where he misquoted FDR? Of course.
Yes. You said Nashville is full of musicians because the Great Depression was hard on Tennessee.
Right. What about it?
It made me think that having a band on the ship is important for morale.
What, you want me to get a band together?
Thinking about it. Would you like that?
I don't know. I'm a light cruiser, not a bandmaster.

Fields.MenuText: Yes, but you represent the best of Nashville, and part of that is music.
Yeah. I'm glad you're a light cruiser before a bandmaster, believe me.
You can be more than one thing in life.

Fields.DialogueText: A lot of it is music. You have a point there, Captain.
I don't exactly plan to go out like the Titanic.
Thanks for the permission. I'll think about it.
Music can bring people together and, as you said, lift their spirits.
Especially boogie-woogie!
Maybe ask Clatch for a hand in getting the band together.
Did he set you up for this?
No. I'm not his wingman.
You dislike being a wingman?
I'm the captain. Let's leave it at that.
Is that an order?
Don't roll your eyes at me, Nashville. Now let's get to stations. That one's an order.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
What's this task force I've heard about?
Something Command is considering - I don't have too many details yet. How did you hear?
I have my ways. We have to join it.
We'll see what Command decides.
No. We don't have to join it. We have to lead it.

Fields.MenuText: I determine what we lead or don't lead. Well, in this case I don't. But as a general rule, I do.
I'm impressed by your desire to lead.
Where does this come from?

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry. I know that you're the captain.
Add that to the list.
I want to whip their butts. Where the hell else?
Why do you think that a task force will help?
Strength in numbers.
Are you feeling a little vulnerable?
Don't make this personal, Captain.
You don't need to be defensive. We're all feeling a little vulnerable these days.
Save it for your shrink. I want to be proactive and not reactive. You know, tactical.
Are you criticizing my tactics?
Now who's being defensive?
Now's the time for both of us to be defensive. Morganas approach!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Captain, we've gotta be more proactive.
More proactive? Now you're a strategic advisor?
I may not be a strategic advisor, Clatch, but I'm tired as hell of being a sitting duck.
I wouldn't say we've been just sitting around.
Agreed. We're on regular, high-risk patrols here. And, more to the point, we're following our orders.
Our orders should be to lead the task force against the Morganas.
Nashville, tone it down. You're out of order.
Out of order? I'm not your vassal, Captain. I'm your vessel. Big difference.
But you need to find some more constructive outlet for the impetuousness. It-
Don't forget impertinence. It gets things done. I want to get things done.
We all want that, and we all have our roles to play. I ask that you play yours. And part of that is accepting my command. Understood?
Yep.

Fields.MenuText: It's "Yes, Captain," not "Yep."
Good. Now on to the next mission.
I hope so. We can't have two captains.

Fields.DialogueText: Yep. Got it.
Operation Hurry-Up-And-Wait.
Too many chefs ruin the stew, right?
You are incorrigible.
I'm too young to be incorrigible. That's for old men like Clatch.
Hey, leave me out of it.
Sorry, but no can do. Morganas approach.
I guess our strategy is working.
Watch it, you two.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
... Okay, that was legitimately clever.
How was shore leave? I sure wish I could join y'all.
Me, too. It must be tough being tied to the ship all the time.
The old ball and chain, as they say. If you'll pardon the negativity.
Don't worry. I get it. We get to take a break, but you never do.
My guitar gets me most of the way there.

Fields.MenuText: It gives a little reprieve to all of us, and I'm grateful for it.
Is that why you are always playing?
We're lucky to have a musical Belle.

Fields.DialogueText: Aw, shucks. That's awful good of you, Captain.
I'm not always playing. I do sleep from time to time.
I'm lucky to have a... well, a "you" for a captain.
Have you thought more about starting a house band?
I like the idea. There's a lot of talent on board this cruiser.
You think so?
You just have to have the ear to hear it. Hear that?
What? I don't hear anything.
The sound of the gulls and the sea.
I know this sounds nuts, but I sometimes think the sea is speaking to me.
Well, if it is, I hope it's telling you that Morganas are approaching.
How are you always the first to know?
Perfect pitch.
@BATTLE
Clatch, after the war is over, you gotta come to the Grand Ole Opry.
Really?
Yep, it's really something. An experience you'll never forget.
I might just do that. I used to listen to it on the radio all the time.
What was your favorite act?
Gosh, too many to mention. I really liked DeFord Bailey.
Get out! He's one of my all-time favorite musicians. I've tried to play harp because of him. Want to hear?
Not right now. I have a question for the captain.
Well, get in line cuz I got a question for the captain myself.

Fields.MenuText: I had no idea I was in such demand.
Before answering any questions, I need to go over some recent developments with you.
I have a question for both of you.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't let it get to your head.
I almost attended that meeting today, Captain!
Why do I feel like I'm in trouble when I haven't done anything wrong?
Don't worry. Nobody's in trouble. I have some news. We may be closer to that task force than you think.
What do you mean?
This is going to have to wait. Morganas are closing in quickly.
To battle stations!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Listen, before we get to anything else, I have some news. We may be closer to that task force than you think.
Nashville, where did this chicken come from?
*CLUCK*
Aww, she clucks because you hold her like you're afraid. Give her to me.
Where in the world did you get a chicken?
Where did you find her? She's smarter than you think.
You haven't answered my question.
Come on, Baby Girl. Let momma bring you home. What was that? You wanna see the ocean?
You know this chicken!?
Stop yelling, for goodness' sake. It upsets Baby Girl.
Sorry. Where did Baby Girl come from?
Nashville. Where else?
Where else, indeed. Does she have any... friends?
If you are asking if I have a chicken coop on board, I decline to answer that.

Fields.MenuText: Are you kidding me right now?
A chicken coop? Where?
I am going to take that as a no. A firm, definitive no.

Fields.DialogueText: Why would I ever kid about chickens? Where's the humor in that?
Tucked behind the whiskey still.
Bless your heart, Captain. I knew you'd have a soft spot for Baby Girl.
I really can't believe this.
Believe it, Captain. Look, Baby Girl likes you! She has good taste.
Well, I'll take that as a compliment, I suppose.
Would you like to meet the other girls and Rufus?
Who is Rufus?
He's the cock. No eggs without a cock.
I imagine.
Are you blushing? I just call it like I see it.
Are those Morganas I hear? You better put Baby Girl in a safe place. It's going to get ugly here in a minute.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Come on, Baby Girl. Momma's got work to do!
Heya... oh. Is that a chicken?
You must have aced biology. Say hello to Baby Girl.
Does the captain know?
Yes, the captain and Baby Girl are well acquainted.
And what did the captain say?
Didn't have time to say much. Morganas arrived. I don't understand why a few chickens matter one way or another.
I'm allergic to chicken. When I eat it, I break out something fierce. It's awful.
Well, you aren't going to be eating Baby Girl! Or any of them. These chickens are off-limits.
How do you reconcile eating chickens and having them as pets?
Pretty easily. I don't overthink it.
Sometimes that's the only way. Otherwise, how could we be doing any of this?
Baby Girl loves seeing the seagulls. Look at her. She's fascinated by them.
There you two are. Oh, and Baby Girl. Why isn't she back in her pen?
Coop, not pen. And she is sick of being cooped up, kinda like me!
*CLUCK!*

Fields.MenuText: Baby Girl needs to go back to her quarters.
Maybe we can put her to work. Tie cloths to her feet and she can clean the deck.
I guess a little fresh air is good for her.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, Captain. She'll go back as soon as the coast is clear.
We'd have to dirty it up with some seed first.
Thank you, Captain. Maybe you aren't as stuffy as you seem.
I never thought I'd see the day when a chicken would be part of my crew.
War is full of surprises!
I hate to interrupt, but speaking of surprises...
Morganas!
*CLUCK!*
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Quiet down now, my favorite part is coming.
Let me guess. Lux Lewis?
You're catching on.
I'm not as dumb as I look.
Thank God for tender mercies.
Hey, you aren't supposed to agree with me.
You look like a captain, and captains aren't dumb. A little thick sometimes, maybe...
I have something to tell you.
It can't wait until the song is over?
I want you to know that I've organized a special dinner for you. I told the cook to go, as you put it, "all out."
But why? I ain't won the war quite yet.
We all want to thank you for being such a brave Belle. We're alive right now in no small part due to you.
Aw, Captain. I'm awful touched. What's on the menu?

Fields.MenuText: Chicken. Crew excluded.
Some of your favorites. I asked the cook.
All you need to do is show up with your guitar.

Fields.DialogueText: Make it hot, Captain. The hotter the better.
Ooh, I like the sound of that. Hot chicken and pickles!
I never leave my quarters without it.
I'm grateful for you, Nashville. I don't tell you enough.
Dang it, there they are again! Morganas know how to kill a mood.
They know how to kill a lot of things.
They make me so mad! How dare they destroy our way of life!
They haven't destroyed it.
Not on my watch!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Well, now you mention it...
Where is Baby Girl?
She's brooding.
Brooding? What's wrong? She has a wonderful life.
Brooding means something different with chickens.
What does it mean?
Warming her eggs, I believe.
Eggs? I hadn't thought of that! Does the cook know? I'll take mine poached!
Clatch, you have been enjoying Baby Girl's eggs since you got on board.
I had no idea.
What you don't know could fill this ship.
Hey, it isn't Pick-on-Clatch Day.
Isn't every day Pick-on-Clatch Day?
It sure feels like it.

Fields.MenuText: I'd swear you were siblings if you weren't different species.
Come on, you two. Get along.
I can't believe the cook knew before I did.

Fields.DialogueText: Different species? I guess we are. Well, how do you like that?
Is that an order, Captain? Aw, forget I asked that.
I wonder what else the cook knows. If anyone knows everything aboard a ship, it's the cook.
Well, I'm going to talk to the cook right now anyway. Need to plan for Nashville's big dinner.
What's this?
Don't worry, you're invited.
I guess they're letting anybody come.
Yes, in fact, we are. We're all grateful to you, Nashville.
Is Baby Girl invited, too?
She's a guest of honor!
I thought I was the guest of honor!
We can have more than one, can't we?
*ALARM*
Several, apparently.
Don't roll your eyes! Get to battle stations!
@BATTLE
Anything to report, Nashville?
Achoo!
Bless you!
Thank you, Captain. These darn allergies won't quit.
What are you allergic to?
Chickens, for one.
Are you kidding me?
Well, their feathers.
Why did you bring Baby Girl on board then?
She's my best friend.
You are a strange Belle.
I knew you wouldn't understand.
It's not that I don't understand. It's just unusual.
Would you prefer I were "usual"?

Fields.MenuText: Not at all. Your quirks make you... Nashville.
I'd prefer you put your health first. We rely on you.
I'm hesitant to answer that.

Fields.DialogueText: And don't you forget it.
A few sneezes won't get me down. I'm tougher than that.
You don't have to. I think I know the answer.
Just take care of yourself, Nashville. That's all I ask.
*ALARM*
Morganas approaching!
This is why we need you in top shape!
@BATTLE
I'll shape you.
Captain, do you hear that?
What? I don't hear anything. Do you, Nashville?
Not really, but Baby Girl was acting weird this morning.
Do chickens have good hearing?
They are powerful sensitive to atmospheric disturbances.
Is it a ship? A siren? A bomber?
Perhaps. It's hard to see through the fog.
I still don't hear anything.
Something's not right. I can feel it in my guitar.
Could it be Morganas?

Fields.MenuText: It could be anything. Or nothing. It's somehow outside the range of my hearing.
In your guitar?
We have to assume it is.

Fields.DialogueText: It's not so much a sound as it is a... vibration.
I can feel it vibrating.
But what can we do if we can't see anything?
*ALARM*
Well, that answers our questions. To battle stations!
I still want to know what that was.
We may find out sooner rather than later!
Or we may never find out. That's how war goes.
@BATTLE
Captain, you need a hobby.
Why? Aren't I busy enough?
Hobbies are fun, and they help you relax.
I'll relax when the war is over, not before.
What if it never ends?
Oh, it'll end. Everything ends. "When" is the question.
You have to live for right now. A hobby would be good for you. Take your mind off the war.
I can see this is an argument I'm not going to win. What do you have in mind?
Maybe a guitar lesson?

Fields.MenuText: If only I knew someone who could teach me.
Whew. I was afraid you were going to suggest raising chickens.
There's enough musical talent on board as it is.

Fields.DialogueText: If only. I'm sure if you think about it you'll come up with an answer.
Raising chickens isn't really a hobby. It's more of a passion.
Excuse me? Music is the language of the soul. Everyone has one of those.
Well, there's no time like the present, right?
We just need to get you a guitar, and I think I know where to find one.
Can't I play yours?
That questions would have landed anyone else in the infirmary. Besides, what would I play?
I don't know. Maybe we could both try something new.
I... wait. Is there some subtext to that? Don't you like my music?
I do! I just figured you might enjoy learning some new songs, new ways to play. You know, expand your repertoire.
I see.
Hey, where are you going?
I'm going to expand my repertoire.
What about my lesson?
*ALARM*
Penciled in somewhere.
@BATTLE
Captain, have you seen Nashville? I've been looking for her.
I haven't seen her, but I've heard her.
Heard her?
Can't you hear that caterwauling?
That sound coming from the engine room?
That's it. She likes the way the music vibrates off the metal down there.
She's an odd duck, that one.
But she's a good egg.
That's as far as my avian humor will take me.
Wait. Hear that?
What?
Silence. Finally, the sweet sound of silence. Hello, Nashville. Coming up for air?
Howdy, Captain. Clatch.

Fields.MenuText: I've been enjoying your, um, music.
Doesn't it get hot down there?
How about taking a break? A good, long break.

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks! It's a new ditty I'm working on.
I love the heat. Reminds me of home. Makes me work up a thirst.
I need to, actually. I broke a string or three.
Listen, it's time to inspect the ship. You and Clatch can start on the upper deck.
I prefer to work solo. Sorry, Clatch. It's not personal.
No offense taken.
I'm the captain, and when I give an order, it's to be followed. Understood?
*ALARM*
Why are you just standing there?
Waiting for your order, Captain.
To battle stations, Miss Nashville.
@BATTLE
How far is that as the crow flies?
Oh, rub it in, why don't you.
Don't mind if I do!
Indulge me.
What? No. I mean, why?
I don't mean to get personal, but it seems like you and the Captain are having some issues.
I don't know what you're talking about.
Come on, now. I wasn't born yesterday. What happened?
The Captain's apparently tired of me playing the same old songs, that's all.
Shoot, everyone's tired of you playing the same old songs. Time to change it up!
Truth is, they're the only ones I know. A few I was born with, but I'm self-taught otherwise.
So why don't you teach yourself something new?
I'm trying to, but it's harder than it looks.
I know a few chords. Maybe we could jam together and something will come to you.
Thanks, Clatch, but I wanna figure this out myself.
You are one stubborn gal.
Part of my charm.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Finish that inspection yet, Nashville?
Figure out how to talk more quietly so your commanding officer doesn't hear you talking about them?
Figure what out?

Fields.DialogueText: How long have you been listening, Cap?
All done, Captain. Just making plans for the next exciting phase of my life.
Eh... not yet, I guess...
Run along now. We'll have Morganas to shoot before you know it.
I suppose that makes the Morganas the most charming ladies of all.
*ALARM*
The difference is I know when to quit. And the Captain knows when to step aside.
I don't-
Giving a compliment here. The least you could do is accept it.
Clatch, you're sick as a dog! Why aren't you in sick bay?
I'm sorry, Captain. It just came on so fast.
I hope it's not influenza. Whom have you interacted with in the last 24 hours?
Well, let me see. Nashville, for one. I am sure there are others. My head is just so foggy right now.
I want you to get to sick bay at once. And where's Nashville?
I don't know. She seemed kind of down last I talked to her.
Down? That's not like her. What's going on?
Not sure. She said you didn't like her music.
That's not what I said! Get to sick bay. I'll find Nashville.
Looking for me, Captain?
Yes! How are you feeling?
Right as rain. Why?

Fields.MenuText: Clatch seems to have come down with something. I wanted to make sure you were okay.
Just wondering. You've been acting funny lately.
Do I need a reason to ask how you are doing?

Fields.DialogueText: Aw, crud. Is he okay?
Funny? Like "HA HA" funny, or weird funny?
Of course not. You can do whatever you want. You're the captain, aren't you?
I'm just glad you're feeling okay.
I'm tougher than I seem, Captain.
*ALARM*
So are the Morganas. To battle stations, now!
@BATTLE
Sounded like he might have a fever, but he was moving around on his own steam. Our favorite doctors'll look after him.
Ah, never mind.
I've been thinking. We sort of let the idea of guitar lessons fade away, and that's not what I want. If you're still willing to teach, I'd appreciate the help.
Hey, that's great! But... yeah, maybe not right now. Sorry!
Did I do something I should apologize for?
Not this time. Or, I mean, probably, but I don't know what it would be.
Fair enough. What are you in the middle of? Is it safe to ask?
I'm fixing my still. It sprung a leak.
Oh, well, that sounds important.
It is. Unfortunately, Baby Girl's coop is right behind the still.
Is that a problem?
The moonshine leaked into the coop and she licked it up. She's been drunker than a skunk for the past couple of days.
No wonder we haven't seen her.
She's been sleeping it off.

Fields.MenuText: I wish I could help, but I don't know the first thing about stills.
Sounds like a good idea right about now.
Maybe after that's finished we can start.

Fields.DialogueText: I appreciate the intent. It's not a complicated thing, but it'll take some time to gather the materials and get it done.
I suppose it beats fighting Morganas day and night.
Sure thing, Captain. In the meantime, you need to find an instrument.
Well, I've had some luck on that front. It turns out Clatch had a guitar lying around.
Well, yeah. I built it for him.
How? I mean, with what-
We've got trouble. Let's make sure it stays built!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I'd love to help you out, honestly, but I'm in the middle of something right now.
Anyway, while I'm tied up with drunk chickens, maybe you should find yourself a guitar to practice with.
So, how did you learn to make instruments?
Belle. What I wasn't born with is self-taught.
That's pretty impressive.
Not really. You just have to pay attention to learn how things work.
What other talents do you have up your sleeve?
Too many to mention, I'm sure. By the way, Captain. I wanted to thank you for the dinner.

Fields.MenuText: It was the least we could do, Nashville.
I'm glad you enjoyed it. Was the chicken hot enough?
A little fun goes a long way with the troops.

Fields.DialogueText: It was a real down-home feast.
The hotter the better!
We're all in this together. Even you.
How's the still coming along?
It's coming. I patched it for now so at least Baby Girl isn't getting drunk during the day.
And you? Are you getting drunk during the day?
Trying to. Haven't succeeded yet.
Well, if you can persevere, so can I. How about those lessons?
Sure! Let's get started.
*ALARM*
Looks like the Morganas could use one!
@BATTLE
Lesson one, Cap. Point me at something ugly!
And... honestly, I'm not always so great at that. Learning music I wasn't born with - man, that's been a mess.
No, it hasn't. Remember, the sound carries. You're doing great.
You're just saying that `cause the cooking put you in a good mood.
But, anyway, who cares if I'm doing great? The main thing is that experimenting is fun.
Good. But you *are* doing great.
Pssh!
Did you get a chance to talk to McGinty after dinner?
McGinty?
He's the fellow who yodels. He's from Nashville.
Oh yeah! We did talk for a while.
Did it make you homesick?
Not at all. I don't really get homesick.
I guess that makes sense since you never actually lived there.
It's not that. It's that I'm always looking for the new place, not the old place.

Fields.MenuText: Going after the next shiny thing.
You have the heart of an explorer.
Traveling is one of the few war-time perks.

Fields.DialogueText: Like a ship's figurehead - always looking forward.
Reckon my songs wouldn't be so sweet if I didn't.
Traveling, definitely. And meeting people like you. And Clatch. And McGinty.
We're quite a motley crew.
When there are people from all over, you get to be yourself. Your new friends might see you a certain way you didn't.
I'm glad you're comfortable with us. I was worried at first.
Why? Couldn't handle my sass?
*ALARM*
You're an acquired taste.
@BATTLE
So's moonshine. We both knock you on your ass. Now, getting back up? That's the real test.
Nashville! Why are colored streamers hung all over the ship? And where did you get the balloons?
It's to celebrate Francis Nash's birthday!
Who is he, might I ask?
The founder of Nashville, of course. I worry about your grasp of American history, Captain.
I know enough history to not want to know any more. So it's Nash's birthday?
Not exactly. Nobody knows the exact date of his birth. Record-keeping back then and all. I celebrate it whenever I think of it.

Fields.MenuText: I see. A variable holiday. And can it come more than once a year?
We're lucky it's on your mind. The ship looks very festive, for a change.
Is there going to be a celebration, with music perhaps?

Fields.DialogueText: Why not? Let's not have rules around it.
Thank you! I'm glad you like it!
That would be great. I've been working on a new song just for him.
Well, let me know if there's going to be a concert to celebrate Mr. Nash. I'd like to play something for you.
Captain, you've been practicing!
Trying to, in between battles and other duties. You were right. It helps me enjoy each moment more.
Well, good. You think of that, you think of me.
*ALARM*
I hate to sound like a broken record, but... to battle stations!
@BATTLE
Oh, forget records. This one's live!
Nashville, isn't it a little early for a nip?
I'm not nipping, just tasting. It's the first brew in my new still.
How does it taste?
Like fire. Care for a sample?

Fields.MenuText: Perhaps after dinner, if you will join me.
No, thank you. I prefer to remain sober, for now.
Let me smell it.

Fields.DialogueText: Moonshine in the moonlight? Sounds dandy.
It's good for a captain to be sober. But too much of a good thing, you know.
Careful it doesn't singe your nose hairs.
Whew! That is really strong. My eyes are stinging just from smelling it.
Isn't it great? Old family recipe.
Keep Baby Girl far away from that stuff. And Clatch.
Oh don't worry. This is my private selection. Spirits for a spirit!
I forget sometimes that you are a spirit.
What do you think I am, then?
You are my Belle. I mean our Belle. You are our Belle.
No take-backs. It's an honor to be your Belle, Captain.
*ALARM*
Saved by the bell. To battle stations, Nashville!
@BATTLE
What will you do after the war, Nashville?
Travel.
You don't think you'll get tired of it, always moving from place to place?
As long as there are new things to see, new people to meet, I don't see how I could get tired of it.
They say life on the ocean is a lonely one.
I don't see it that way. I don't think I've ever been lonely.
You are a bright light.
I wish I were a bright light! I'm getting a little tired of this fog.
I think the whole ship would agree. It's funny how the weather impacts outlook.
I wrote a new song. Wanna hear it?
Sure! I'd love to.
It's called "The Foggy Tonk Blues."

Fields.MenuText: The weather has inspired you!
Should I go grab my guitar so I can accompany you?
The fog sure does give the blues.

Fields.DialogueText: I guess it has. Okay, here we go! And a one and a two...
I don't think you'd be able to keep up. Here we go! And a one and a two...
And the blues thrill me. Ready? Here we go! And a one and a two...
So, what do you think?
I like it. I like it a lot, except...
Except what?
It sounds an awful lot like your old song. Just with an extra verse about...
A captain who sings the blues?
Well, that's not a bad thing. I like your old song and I like your new song.
Maybe you just like me, Captain.
Is that a bad thing?
No, no it isn't.
*ALARM*
Can I ask a favor?
After this battle, you can ask anything you like.
What about a kiss?
*ONE BALLAD LATER*
Until a pretty girl cruises in with something more upbeat.
We'll have to survive, won't we? Think you can keep to the beat?
